comments.body:
That's a great idea, but I believe it has been taken from this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=30BmmdCnc3A specifically at the time of 1:34-1:56

You can confirm or deny that, but if you have in fact taken the idea from that video then you should add the link somewhere in the post.
Wolve, merely laying down also resets the sleep deprivation timer, thus circumventing the issue of multiplayer sleep mechanics
...Killer Rabbit?
Given enough time, every grass block would become a burrow then. The point of minecraft is to be a sandbox world controlled by the player. Let's not make mobs too destructive.
I don't like the burrow, but instead I would like just 6-7 rabbits just to spawn near your crops.So they can trample them
what about iron nuggets?
So people could just feed an almost broken chest plate to their golem to give it massive regen?

@TheFriendlyPine They are too small to heal. They would after correct mathematics heal the Golem by 0.33333333333...

@Bilbo Baggins I didn‚Äôt think about that. Maybe you could only feed it unused armor? Do you have an idea?

I believe that having the iron block and ingots heal more or the pumpkin healing less would be better as pumpkins are easily farmed and iron is not.
Another thing would be that the armour would likely need to only give a small amount since you could just give an almost broken chest-plate to the golem.

(images work fine, no need to test. ~ nb)
the test wasn't to see if images were possible btw

I took away the armor because of three reasons:  

1. The armor caused some trouble with the durability. 

2. If armor is taken into the list, swords, shears and everything else made of iron would have to go there too. 

3. The game should make you choose what you want to do: Help your village‚Äôs Golem or help yourself. 

Also, on Mitchell Abererd‚Äôs request, I changed the healing points of pumpkins. 

Is this better? Please let me know what you think.
Pretty much done by now, huh? At least for Iron Golems.

it always really bothered me that villagers would rather spawn a completely new golem (and sometimes they don't even seem to be able to do that) rather than keep their current golem alive, so I support the idea of them being able to repair their golems somehow! However, I think it would be better if you could also right-click the golem directly.
Villagers healing golems would be sooo nice. (but only during the day, 'cause logic)
Makes sense.
This exists in the bedrock beta version that has cats in it, a black cat spawns there and follows the witch,
Paradiscal Really? Cool!
This idea is in the game! Wooho! üëè
This is in the game, but I don't know if it follows the witch.
Done and done my dude!
Great idea!!!
There should be a way of befriending them too, such as offering berries.
Agreed
And just how are you going to avoid this puffer fish? Not all devices allow you to move smoothly.
hi can i get a acount plz my father say no plz java  my user must de xavypr01234
peak
üëç
bedrock will just be on its prime üî•
Peak
Yeah, I want penguins!

Mojang doesn't want to implement real-life hostile mobs, so it's extremely unlikely that sharks will be added to Minecraft.
However, there are actually many types of sharks, and with the exception of a few dangerous sharks, most of them are neutral, and some of them are friendly sharks such as whale sharks. Or you could add friendly sharks.
I love them too!

Ohhhh. I wondered why they said no sharks, but didn't realize it was because they are real life creatures. But just to set this straight, sharks hardly ever attack humans. In fact, deaths by shark attack are insanely rare. Only a few sharks are actually dangerous, like the tiger shark and bull shark. While the others certainly can attack people, the odds of that are astronomical.
Or they could be like lab rats for my new redstone contraptions.

Absolutely would love Guinea pigs in Minecraft! One thing i would suggest is that the Guinea pigs can be useful, they could attack spiders and collect the string for you! Something different an out of the ordinary! Definitely want different colors of Guinea pigs though!
i love piggies

In reality, whale sharks are also facing a very serious threat of extinction.
I think this is the best way to protect the marine ecosystem.
The iceologer was put into MC Dungeons and the Barnacle was repurposed into the magma block bubble column feature.

Why not The Great Hunger, Glare, Moobloom, and Rascal? These seem like they would actually be useful or look nice for Minecraft? Not to mention that The Great Hunger looks prehistoric, much like the Sniffer that won the mob vote in 2022.

reply to comment
it doesn't make a difference to normal Minecraft players, if iceologer was added to MC dungeons, but the barnacle thing makes sense

The iceologer was in Dungeons before the mob vote. If they did this, the vote would be Iceologer, Copper Golem, and Rascal, because they came in 2nd in their respective votes. I don't think the 2017 mobs would get another chance, and especially not the Barnacle, because it lost that vote.
I agree
yes i was thinking of random mobs from the past to get a second chance and there are three mob votes.

probably not the barnicle because its to dangerous

maybe these mobs

1. crab

2. copper golem or tuff golem

3. iceologer
Boa ideia!
the red panda when provoked, since it is a small animal, it should not attack, but climb to the tops of trees or bamboos and stay there until the player leaves the area
Yes. just yes:)

I definitely think Mojang should reconsider adding fireflies because they would liven up the swamps. They could have alternative uses than being food for frogs (since they were removed for being poisonous). They would be perfect for ambience and a new light source. Maybe we could put them in jars for a portable light source or they could have some other unique attributes.
Fue muy bueno

That would be amazing; it could also be used to organise and more easily identify your allays. Or maybe that they change colour based on their biome, or that you find them in different colours naturally.

It should be the other way around, lightning turns vexes into allays.

But have it so throwing a certain potion prevents the vex from dying

I absolutely agree with you. Especially in the minecraft realms. I have noticed an endless wave of hostile mobs spawning dark area. It takes always from the fun of exploring the game for myself. I am complete unable to explore an area without completely lighting up the area first. If I don‚Äôt and try to kill some they will spawn faster then I can kill them. An easy fix would be allowing the player the adjust the hostile mob spawning cap on bedrock.

I absolutely agree. I just picked up Minecraft for the first time in a few years and it's not fun at all to play. Starting out in a new game I'm dying every 10 minutes before I can even get the basics. It's so frustrating and I'm about ready to put it back on the shelf until something gets fixed.

I agree with this whole heartedly. Either you have to go into caves and die repeatedly just to make armor, for a creepee to come and obliterate you. They spawn way to fast to kill. The skeletons have become absolutely ridiculous and just bounce me around like a ragdoll if there's more then 2, creeper spawn rate is absurd, as well as zombies. And yeah I can find iron in mountain areas butnif I don't spawn in one I have to look for over an hour if I'm lucky. Now I also ALWAYS have to make a bed asap otherwise you won't survive the night right off the bat. Just lower mob spawn rate in caves and I'd be happy. Above ground spawn rafe is normal. Why are caves triple. I don't even enjoy the game anymore. I only play solo cause no wifi. And I feel like you made this into a team based game only now.
In real life bats like darkness so it just makes sense.

I love this idea. Whether it's the Glare or the Bat, it should also have another feature: when you hold a light source, it will fly n blocks away from as many light level 1 blocks as possible, where n is the light level of the light source your holding. This would be faster, less tedious, and less visually strenuous then using F3, while still spacing your lights perfectly.

I like the idea of taming the bat and it will perch on your shoulders like parrots do

Maybe by feeding them spider eyes or flowers/honey, I remember that certain bats eat insects while others eat flowers nectar

With the changes to lighting it will be less usefull compared to previous versions, but it's still a thing that will help a lot
I think this is a GREAT idea. I personally made my own post about that the losing mobs should still be honored by adding their ideas to other areas of the game.
It makes so much sense. More sense that adding an entire new mob
ijwgm fkl,zsdkfmlkdsXZ,ml;saf<MZXdv,lkn
um- im scared of the nether as it is-
Puede ser pero no tendr√≠a tanto sentido pero podr√≠a ser como los gatos
This is a vary good idea I'm surprised they haven't added racoons yet best of luck to you.
Im sorry but i don't think they'll add this. It may cause little kids to try to tame a raccoon in real life.
This is a very good idea!

I love this idea! Racoons are my favorite animal and I would love to have them in Minecraft and I really like the idea of them protecting their family like a wolf would! They should really add racoons to Minecraft
Neigh
Neigh I'm a unicorn. Hello fellow unicorns
Neigh indeed!

I would have voted for this if it hadn't been these few issues. If you got regeneration while riding it, that would make them wayyy too OP. Second, if you can "fly" with them that would destroy the purpose of elytra. If you made unicorn wings using elytra, wouldn't it be easier to just use the elytra itself? The elytra is an amazing item that has been around for a while. No support from me sorry, but I just think this is a ridiculous and silly idea itself. This would be great for a mod though.

I think the unicorn needs to be a neutral mob.
This is because unicorns have a very ferocious personality, and if they accidentally attack, they will rush and kill them with their weapons.
Of course, when attacked by another mob, that mob will be killed as well.
However, it is possible to run much faster than a horse.

Yes, I'm a dude, and I still like the idea of unicorns in Minecraft even though they are often labelled as girly.

I think they shouldn't fly, because when you look up 'unicorn' you don't see many winged ones.

But they should do something cool that normal horses can't, like maybe they can fight hostile mobs for you with their horns. I think that would be pretty cool. I like the idea of a unicorn horn, but they should be used to craft spears, a new weapon, not unicorn wings because unicorns don't have wings.

I think they should have a chance of spawning in the cherry blossom biome, due to the elegance of the biome and the mob.
I agree
Imagine if we could tame and ride them!
Do it
I feel like the fire creeper could have some sort of gimmick, like instead of exploding, they heal or give buffs to your enemies, but not directly attacking you, that would make it more unique
How about an undead Kindled Creeper ?
